BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NORTH TEXAS HIGHER EDUCATION AUTHORITY INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Acquire student loans and provide life of loan servicing of student loans at post secondary level.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Provide student loans at post secondary level and life of loan servicing of student loans.
IRS990.Desc: Student Loan Programs: provide funds mostly through issuance of bonds for the purchase and life of loan servicing of FFELP student loans at the post secondary level (176,008 loans outstanding).

ContractorCompensationGrp.ServicesDesc: Program Administration and Student loan Servicing

ProgramServiceRevenueGrp.Desc: Student loan interest and Govt Subsidy

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NTHEA is a member of the Education Finance Council that engages in some direct lobbying activities. Approximately 10% of NTHEA's membership dues paid to this organization is for the lobbying activity. NTHEA also engages with Graydon Group and Chartwell Strategy Group LLC to provide state and federal lobbying activities.
Amortization of premium reported with revenue for audit but reported in expense for Form 990
Amortization of premium reported with revenue for audit but reported in expense on Form 990

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule K, Part IV, Line 2c-05/25/2010 207,200,000 NTHEA Series 2010 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No liability was due as of the first five year arbitrage rebate installment calculation date of the Bond which was April 30, 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule K, Part IV, Line 2c-10/28/2010 125,050,000 NTHEA Series 2010 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No liability was due as of the first five year arbitrage rebate installment calculation date of the Bond which was April 30, 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NTHEA Board members nominate persons to serve on the Board. However the Governing Body of the City of Arlington, Texas, appoints members to the NTHEA Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Governing Body of the City of Arlington, Texas, must approve the financings related to proposed bond issues before NTHEA can issue bonds.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The NTHEA Form 990 is prepared by the Controller of Higher Education Servicing Corp (HESC). The Form 990 is then reviewed and approved by the Treasurer of NTHEA and the Chief Executive Officer of HESC. HESC is the program management company for NTHEA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A member of NTHEA's Bond Counsel Firm attends every Board meeting. The Bond Counsel reviews the conflict of interest policy with the Board members on an annual basis and enforces compliance with the policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NTHEA makes its audited financial statements and reports available to the public by placing them on an investment page that can be accessed from the web. NTHEA does not make its governing documents and conflict of interest policy available to the public.

Income is interest received on outstanding student loans to students and supplemental interest received from the Federal Government for financing of education at post-secondary institutions. Income received is totally related to exempt purposes of funding educational loans.

Program expenses: Bond rating expense $164,292, Bond trustee fees $144,862, Loan commitment fees $25,000, Student Loan servicing fees $3,017,148, Borrower Benefit write-off's $1,101,180, and Cost of Issuance fees $1,473,331. Mgmt general expenses: Bank service fees $25,648, miscellaneous expense $27,287.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Program administration and Student Loan Servicer
